page.title: 01Endon with Stanley.
page.content: This rural parish lies to the extreme north of the county of Staffordshire.It is midway between the pottery city of Stoke-on-Trent and the market town of Leek.In the Endon area, much of the land is low lying and the natural drainage facilities are very poor.This has resulted in flooding in the Endon valley.Recently,plenty has been done to improve matters.For over a century there has been a railway through Endon.Passengers and freight were carried until about twenty years ago.Now only quarried stone from Caldon Low is transported by rail to Stoke.In 1777 the Caldon Canal was constructed through Endon carrying flint for the pottery industry.After its decline in importance as a freight carrier it became almost derelict.In recent years it has become a popular source of leisure activity.
